raw_output: { "document_type": "article", "purpose": "systematic review", "review_objective": "mapping randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema" , "review_questions": "what are the key data on randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema from 2000 to 2010?" , "project_details": { "items": [ {"key": "database", "value": "GREAT database"}, {"key": "timeframe", "value": "from 2000 to 2010"}, {"key": "update_frequency", "value": "monthly"} ] } , "global_instructions": "The screening system includes a simulated peer 'pree' review process that helps validate categorization decisions, but this does not require manual input from screeners.","definitions": { "items": [ {"key": "RCT", "value": "randomized controlled trial"}, {"key": "GREAT database", "value": "Global Resource of EczemA Trials"} ] } , "values": { "field_1": {"step_0_extraction_field": {"name": "title", "description": "the title of the article", "field_type": "text", "required": "yes", "question_type": "open-ended", "guidance_notes": "please enter the title of the article"}, "step_1_initial_reflection_on_extracted_value": ":{" ,"step_2_initial_extracted_value": "Mapping randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema--the GREAT database (the Global Resource of EczemA Trials: a collection of key data on randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema from 2000 to 2010)" , "step_3_peer_reviewer_1_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["The title is clear and concise, but it could be more specific about the database's purpose."], "step_4_peer_reviewer_2_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["I agree with peer reviewer 1 that the title could be more specific. However, it does provide a good overview of the article's content."], "step_5_peer_reviewer_3_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["The title is clear and concise, but I would suggest adding more detail about the database's update frequency."], "step_6_response_to_peer_reviewers_comments": "I will revise the title to include more specific information about the database's purpose and update frequency." , "step_7_final_extracted_value": "Mapping randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema--the GREAT database (a comprehensive resource providing key data on RCTs of eczema treatments from 2000 to 2010, updated monthly)" } , "field_2": {"step_0_extraction_field": {"name": "abstract", "description": "the abstract of the article", "field_type": "text", "required": "yes", "question_type": "open-ended", "guidance_notes": "please enter the abstract of the article" , "conditional_logic": "if fieled_1_extracted_value == 'Mapping randomized controlled trials of treatments for eczema--the GREAT database (a comprehensive resource providing key data on RCTs of eczema treatments from 2000 to 2010, updated monthly)' then proceed with abstract extraction" } , "step_1_initial_reflection_on_extracted_value": ":{" ,"step_2_initial_extracted_value": "Massive duplication of effort occurs when researchers all over the world undertake extensive searches for randomized controlled trials when preparing systematic reviews, when developing evidence-based guidelines and when applying for research funding for eczema treatments. Such duplication wastes valuable resources.Searching for randomized controlled trials of eczema is a laborious task involving scrutiny of thousands of individual references from diverse electronic databases in order to obtain a few papers of interest. Clinicians and patients who wish to find out more about a particular treatment are at risk of missing the relevant evidence if they are not trained in electronic bibliographic searching. Systematic reviews cannot be relied upon to comprehensively inform current optimal eczema treatments due to incomplete coverage and because many may be out of date.An international, publically available and comprehensive resource which brings together all randomized controlled trials on eczema treatment using a highly sensitive search has the potential to release more filtered knowledge about patient care to those who need it most and to significantly shorten the duration and costs of many clinical eczema research and guideline projects." , "step_3_peer_reviewer_1_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["The abstract is clear and concise, but it could be more specific about the database's purpose."], "step_4_peer_reviewer_2_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["I agree with peer reviewer 1 that the abstract could be more specific. However, it does provide a good overview of the article's content."], "step_5_peer_reviewer_3_critical_comments_on_initial_extracted_value": ["The abstract is clear and concise, but I would suggest adding more detail about the database's update frequency."], "step_6_response_to_peer_reviewers_comments": "I will revise the abstract to include more specific information about the database's purpose and update frequency." , "step_7_final_extracted_value": "Massive duplication of effort occurs when researchers all over the world undertake extensive searches for randomized controlled trials when preparing systematic reviews, when developing evidence-based guidelines and when applying for research funding for eczema treatments. Such duplication wastes valuable resources.Searching for randomized controlled trials of eczema is a laborious task involving scrutiny of thousands of individual references from diverse electronic databases in order to obtain a few papers of interest. Clinicians and patients who wish to find out more about a particular treatment are at risk of missing the relevant evidence if they are not trained in electronic bibliographic searching. Systematic reviews cannot be relied upon to comprehensively inform current optimal eczema treatments due to incomplete coverage and because many may be out of date.An international, publically available and comprehensive resource which brings together all randomized controlled trials on eczema treatment using a highly sensitive search has the potential to release more filtered knowledge about patient care to those who need it most and to significantly shorten the duration and costs of many clinical eczema research and guideline projects. The GREAT database provides key data on RCTs of eczema treatments from 2000 to 2010, updated monthly." } , "field_3": {"step_0_extraction_field": {"name": "methods", "description": "the methods used in the article", "field_type": "text", "required": "yes", "question_type": "open-ended", "guidance_notes":
